refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The client subcommand defines a client of a service on an interface or router. Any rule-params given to a parent interface or router are inherited by the client, but are reversed.
For FireHOL a client is the source of a request. Even though this is more complex for some multi-socket services, to FireHOL a client always initiates the connection.
The service parameter is one of the supported service names from . Multiple services may be specified, space delimited in quotes.
The action can be any of the actions listed in .
The rule-params define a set of rule parameters to further restrict the traffic that is matched to this service. See for more details.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.programlisting:
client smtp accept
client "smtp pop3" accept
client smtp accept src 192.0.2.1
client smtp accept log "mail packet" src 192.0.2.1
